Ooaman

I notice a lot of times in my opinion that a lot of movies that a sequels or trilogy (or any way, not the first one) most people say that they are never as good as the first one. Now granted, some movies should never have a sequel, like Armageddon, Titanic, ect. (Where would the sequel go in those, would it be worth it for anything other than a spoof.) I'd like to read opinions based upon movies where the sequel (or any part in a series) was better than the first. Or, were there movies that had a sequel that shouldn't have had a sequel.
Master_Shake

Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, and Harry Potter of course. Albeit, I think I'd have to put them in a slightly different category because the stories weren't affected nearly as much by audience expectations as they were written before any of the movies were released.
 
 Other than that, off the top of my head I'd say the Star Trek movies, Shrek 2, Toy Story 2, Spiderman 2, and Batman Begins (I don't know if that qualifies as a sequel or not though.)
 
 If I think of any more I'll add them.
emoreno2292

Sequels that should not be in existence:
 Jaws sequels
 Blair Witch Project sequel
 Jurassic park sequels. Jesus, yes, these should never have been thought into existence.
 Same goes for the Matrix sequels.
 
 Good sequels
 Kill Bill 2
 Spiderman 2, I suppose
 Lord of the Rings, I suppose, were ok. Not horrible.
Ooaman

Other than that, off the top of my head I'd say the Star Trek movies, Shrek 2, Toy Story 2, Spiderman 2, and Batman Begins (I don't know if that qualifies as a sequel or not though.)

 Batman Begins (I would say and believe) was a prequel. But that still makes it part of the storyline (I think.) Also, it kept in line with the other Batman movies by having some one new play Batman. Maybe there should be a thred started on Superhero movies and Prequel movies. emoticon_idea
Ooaman

Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, and Harry Potter of course. Albeit, I think I'd have to put them in a slightly different category because the stories weren't affected nearly as much by audience expectations as they were written before any of the movies were released.

 Hey, what would have happened if the first movie in the series came out and completely bombed at the box-office? Say Fellowship of the Rings or Sorcerer's Stone made money in the thousands (less then $500,000 in ticket sales). Would they have made the second? Or would there just be a lot of disappointed fans that just turned them into a Cult Classic? (I believe that $500,000 is less than half of what it took to film and produce LOTR.)
unkerpaulie

the jurassic park sequel (part 2) was actually surprisingly as good as part 1 in my opinion. part 3 was garbage. the matrix part 2 and 3 added nothing to the depth of the original idea, and were solely for commercial benefit.
 
 anybody seen the transporter 2? i doubt it could be as good as the first one, as it looks more like all action than intelligent plot. remember how horrid mission impossible 2 was?
OccamsRazor

Alien and Aliens are rare examples (in my opinion at least) where a sequel measured up to an outstanding original film.
 
 The Godfather trilogy as well.
 
 I see most people disliked Matrix II/III as I did, although I can almost excuse II for the scene where Neo meets the Architect- aside from the compelling dialogue the background images that are playing as the Architect speaks are interesting indeed.
Ooaman

 Also Jurassic Park 4 is supposed to come out...
 Some time soon.
 Indiana Jones 4 is supposed to come out...
 Some time period.
Bassman
Guess what! Sly Stallone is set to direct <drum roll, please< Rocky VI. It's been what, 15 years since the last movie?
Matthew S

I see most people disliked Matrix II/III as I did, although I can almost excuse II for the scene where Neo meets the Architect- aside from the compelling dialogue the background images that are playing as the Architect speaks are interesting indeed.

 
 
 I Liked any scene that included the Oracle but I agree most of matrix 2 and 3 did suck.
Master_Shake

Guess what! Sly Stallone is set to direct <drum roll, please< Rocky VI. It's been what, 15 years since the last movie?

 emoticon_cry Oh geez. Why must he subject us to his planet-sized ego???!!!!! emoticon_cry emoticon_cry :xcensored :xbanghead
Bassman
Yeah, the last movie tanked so bad, it wasn't even close to funny.
Ooaman

Would it be possible for Rocky VI to be a contender? emoticon_xclown 
 
 Actually, I keep hearing plans for (this is what I would like to see based on opinion of my own) Jurassic Park IV and for Indiana Jones IV. Both I would like to see. I've also heard plans for Ghostbusters 3. I heard plans one week and they were denied the next week. I've also heard rumors of an Independence Day II. But for next year, I'm looking forward to X-Men 3.
Ooaman
Oh, and I've also heard for plans for a Scarey Movie IV. I hear it is to come out in April and be directed by the guys who did the third one. emoticon_xgood :p emoticon_smile emoticon_xhoho
Master_Shake

I've also heard rumors of an Independence Day II.

 Really?? How could they do that and have it make any sense??
Ooaman

Really?? How could they do that and have it make any sense??

 Well I've heard that it was going to happen but then there are always rumors about movies coming out that never get made or brought out. For example, there was a movie made back in about '97 called The Fantastic 4. It was filmed but never released. It was not even brought out on tape or DVD. The movie that came out this last summer is actually the second movie made. Now Hollywood is always making sequels to movies that don't really work. (Home Alone 3 for example) It may work as a spinoff. One of the rumors I heard or read was that what happened was that Dr. Okin (Played by Brent Spiner) never really died. Maybe another group of aliens. Hey, there are plenty of more solar systems in the sky. Maybe it would be 2 groups of aliens. Maybe the ones from the first movie mixed with the aliens from the Aliens series. Something like Alien VS Preditor only Alien VS Independence Day. (AVI - Whoever wins, we blow up.) :p Maybe it would be like a spoof. Something like AF1 - April Fools Day (Now that would be worth it. :p) Over all, I don't know if it will be done or how it would be done. It could take place a few years later.
